update.description:
This is the final part of the “scan and dock” scoring plugin. Here are some notes:

* Only one color sequence submission is allowed.
* A ROS service is used to report the color sequence. This service is only enabled during “running” state.
* Only one successful dock is allowed.
* A dock is considered successful when the vehicle stays within the activation zone of the bay for a minimum amount of time \(a plugin parameter\).
* When the vehicle docks, the task finishes.
* After a successful dock, the plugin also verifies if it was allowed to dock in the current bay. In affirmative case, it grants extra points.
* The activation area of each bay should be relative to the dock. In case of moving the dock, the activation area should move accordingly.

_**~~Note~~**~~: This pull request is built atop of pull request #65, which needs to be merged first.~~_
update.title: Scan and dock scoring plugin - Part3

pull_request.title: Scan and dock scoring plugin - Part3

pullrequest.title: Scan and dock scoring plugin - Part3

content.raw:
Update: I created two variants of the `scan_and_dock` task as we discussed:

* `scan_and_dock_a`: A ROS message is published with a symbol used to dock in the right bay.
* `scan_dock_b`: The light buoy is used to decide which bay is the correct one.

Note that for now, the color sequence and shapes and colors in the placards are random. Therefore, there's no way to pass the expected color sequence or shape and color to the `scan_and_dock` plugin. I’d like to improve it in future releases but I think is enough for this release.
content.html:
Update: I created two variants of the scan_and_dock task as we discussed:

  • scan_and_dock_a: A ROS message is published with a symbol used to dock in the right bay.
  • scan_dock_b: The light buoy is used to decide which bay is the correct one.

Note that for now, the color sequence and shapes and colors in the placards are random. Therefore, there's no way to pass the expected color sequence or shape and color to the scan_and_dock plugin. I’d like to improve it in future releases but I think is enough for this release.

pull_request.title: Scan and dock scoring plugin - Part3

pullrequest.title: Scan and dock scoring plugin - Part3

content.raw:
Thanks Brian. I implemented most of your suggestions in [0359b2f](#!/osrf/vrx/commits/0359b2fb2f5bf27f3ccc40d6d48f5cd3e8b4c483?at=default). A few comments:

* The number of extra points are now passed as plugin parameters.
* The docking task is considered finished when the vehicle undocks after docking.
* The elapsed task time is already captured in the `scoring_plugin`. I think there’s no need to add it here.
* I didn’t grant any points for just submitting a color sequence, as I think there’s no much value on it.
* There are now points granted for docking \(in any case\) and extra points granted if the bay was the expected one.
* The idea of splitting this plugin into two plugins \(one for scoring the color sequence and one for scoring the docking\) is clean but the problem is that we designed the `scoring_plugin` in a way that we expect only one instance of it running. Otherwise, both plugins will keep track of time, scoring, publish messages and sounds more complicated. That’s the reason for making this plugin a bit more thick but at least it’s consistent with the structure of the other scoring plugins.
content.html:
Thanks Brian. I implemented most of your suggestions in 0359b2f. A few comments:

  • The number of extra points are now passed as plugin parameters.
  • The docking task is considered finished when the vehicle undocks after docking.
  • The elapsed task time is already captured in the scoring_plugin. I think there’s no need to add it here.
  • I didn’t grant any points for just submitting a color sequence, as I think there’s no much value on it.
  • There are now points granted for docking (in any case) and extra points granted if the bay was the expected one.
  • The idea of splitting this plugin into two plugins (one for scoring the color sequence and one for scoring the docking) is clean but the problem is that we designed the scoring_plugin in a way that we expect only one instance of it running. Otherwise, both plugins will keep track of time, scoring, publish messages and sounds more complicated. That’s the reason for making this plugin a bit more thick but at least it’s consistent with the structure of the other scoring plugins.

pull_request.title: Scan and dock scoring plugin - Part3

pullrequest.title: Scan and dock scoring plugin - Part3

content.raw:
I’m probably missing something, but why are the “scan” and “dock” activities contained in a single plugin?  Seems like it might be simpler to have distinct plugins.

1. The scan plugin would be pretty simple - just check that sequence was submitted and if the sequence was correct.
2. The dock plugin would need to provide the correct docking placard via the API \(e.g., blue triangle\).  Then would detect docking and detect docking in correct bay

For docking, should success require entering the dock, staying in the activation zone for a min. time and also exiting the dock?  

Should scoring for docking also keep track of elapsed time in case of the need for a tie breaker?

Could make things more flexible to have the points be parameters in the SDF, e.g., points for submitting a color sequence and bonus points for the correct sequence.  Ditto for  the docking.
content.html:
I’m probably missing something, but why are the “scan” and “dock” activities contained in a single plugin? Seems like it might be simpler to have distinct plugins.

  1. The scan plugin would be pretty simple - just check that sequence was submitted and if the sequence was correct.
  2. The dock plugin would need to provide the correct docking placard via the API (e.g., blue triangle). Then would detect docking and detect docking in correct bay

For docking, should success require entering the dock, staying in the activation zone for a min. time and also exiting the dock?

Should scoring for docking also keep track of elapsed time in case of the need for a tie breaker?

Could make things more flexible to have the points be parameters in the SDF, e.g., points for submitting a color sequence and bonus points for the correct sequence. Ditto for the docking.
